verbs.description: [ARG1: rondup chemical] [V: involved] [ARG2: in monsanto suit found in many cereals here] how worried you should be corey frey shutterstock a new round of tests from the environmental working group shows the presence of a weed - killer in children breakfast foods like cheerios and lucky charms the chemical in question known as glyphosate has been tentatively linked to cancer though many scientists argue the evidence is n't there yet all but two of the 28 samples in the report showed harmful levels of glyphosate but this safety threshold is far more stringent than the epa standard as the scientific community awaits further research consumers are left to decide whether the products pose a risk chemical safety quaker scientist kellogg iarc bayer tasha stoiber environmental protection agency general mills glyphosate environmental working group journal of epidemiology and public health harvard ewg international agency for research on cancer monsanto associate professor lucky charms alex lu united states environmental protection agency canadian pest management regulatory agency
